docs.title: Overview
docs.text:
This guide will provide information on how to install Windows Server 2008 R2 Standard Edition inside VirtualBox.

All information found in this guide is referenced, written, and optimized by the author to fit the general public.

In any case you encounter an error, please make use of existing AI like chatgpt and "ASK QUESTIONS".

Better yet, you can consult existing forum channels or youtube videos related to the problem you were encountering.

docs.title: Windows Installation
docs.text:
Warning

TAKE THIS NOTE SERIOUSLY

Others in the forum I have visited have reported loop issues during installation.

I suggest you read through all steps to avoid the same fate.

BE PATIENT, AND READ

docs.title: Region Select
docs.text:
After starting the machine for the first time, the first screen to pop up will be this

Just click Next to proceed to the next step.

Here, you will click Install now → then the setup will start

docs.title: OS Selection
docs.text: After the setup has completed, A window will ask us which Operating System we wish to install. For this guide, we will just instull the Standard (Full Installation). Choose that option and click Next then accept the agreement.

docs.title: Installation Type Selection
docs.text:
After accepting the agreement, we will be asked which type of installation do we want. For this choose Custom (advanced).

Warning

DO NOT CHOOSE UPGRADE!!!

You will not be able to upgrade a non-existing system. There was no OS before.

docs.title: Disk Selection
docs.text: On this part, keep Disk 0 selected and click Next

docs.title: Installation Begins
docs.text:
Once you reach this point, keep your fingers out of the keyboard. Do not do Alt + Tab when changing tabs. just click them from your taskbar.

Note

The process may cause some reboots. That's normal. Just wait it out and be patient.

The image below is the reason why you can't touch your keyboard during this part of the installation. As reported here, pressing any key at this part may cause looping during installation.

Just be patient and let the installation go through on its own.

Black screens like these are progress. Just wait them out. Your virtual Machine will be installed soon.

docs.title: Light After Darkness
docs.text: Once you reach this point you are saved. This light gives you the signal to touch that keyboard again.

docs.title: Password Setup
docs.text: Upon encountering this message just click OK and proceed to set up your new password. One that you will remember. After doing that the virtual machine will proceed with its setup.

docs.title: Installation Success!!!
docs.text:
Congratulations, you have now installed Windows Server 2008 R2

Wait for a few moment and Initial Configuration window will pop up. Feel free to install this as you like.

docs.title: Logging in through VirtualBox
docs.text:
Others may find this weird as their usual key combination does not work (Windows Key + Del).

With it, just look at the bottom-right part of the Virtual Machine's window. On the example below you can see Right Ctrl This means my combination for it is (Right Ctrl + Del).

If in any case that was changed on your VirtualBox, just go to your VirtualBox' Preferences > Input > Virtual Machine and find the key or key combination assigned to it.

docs.title: Prerequisites
docs.text: This page will give information to the user on what softwares and tools are required as well as their specifications in order to proceed.

docs.title: Windows Server 2008 R2 Disc Image (.iso)
docs.text:
This is a downloadable installation file that contains the complete setup media for the Windows Server 2008 R2 operating system.

You can get it by clicking this link

Image size is at 2.79Gb.

docs.title: VirtualBox (Oracle)
docs.text:
We need Virtual Box to host the virtual machine that will install our disc image.

To that, just head over to oracle.com/virtualization/virtualbox/ and download an installer that fits your machine. As I am on a Windows machine, I am getting the Windows Installer.

docs.title: VirtualBox Setup
docs.text:
Note

I am using VirtualBox v7.1. Older or newer version of VirtualBox may have different steps or interface.

Click New and when a window pops up, set these configurations. You may tinker with more or less values depending on the capability of your machine

Warning

Giving these settings with less values may cause longer wait time during installation and slower performance of the machine.

Be careful though, larger values may be faster but can torture your machine.

My Suggestion, stay within the green area

SETUP COMPLETE - You may now start the machine.

docs.title: VM Configurations
docs.text:
If a field was not mentioned, keep it as default.
  • VM Name: Windows Server 2008 R2
  • VM Folder: (Choose your own)
  • Base Memory: 4096 MB
  • Number of CPUs: 4
  • Disk Size: 32.00Gb (This is default value, you may change according to your machine's capabilities)

docs.title: Attach the Disk
docs.text:
After completing the Virtual Machine's config by clicking Finish, Select the machine we have just created and then click Settings.

Make sure you are on Expert or Advanced mode then click Storage Tab.

Then under devices, click the empty disk, the side panel on the right should change.

Right at the Optical Drive attribute, click the disk icon then select Choose a Disk File...

After that navigate to the folder where your Windows Server 2008 R2.iso is located and select it.

Complete the process by clicking OK
